wrong_questions.description: Which sentence uses the present perfect tense correctly?
choices: I have went to the store yesterday.
They have finish their project last week.
He have been reading a book.

wrong_questions.description: Choose the sentence with the correct subjectâ€“verb agreement.
choices: The list of items are on the desk.
Neither of the answers were correct.
Each of the students has a book.

wrong_questions.description: Which sentence uses the correct comparative form?
choices: This test is more easier than the last one.
He is the most fast runner on the team.
Her explanation was clearer than before.
This book is gooder than the other one.
